form.PN:
Besedo
tear
pri 1. pomenu izgovarjamo
/t*I*@/
, pri drugih pa
/t*e*@/
.

sense.def:
Tears
so kapljice, ki nam pritečejo iz oči, ko jokamo.

seg.quote: Tears were streaming down her face.
She rushed out of the room, in tears.
When Curzon heard the news, he burst into tears.

sense.def:
To tear something
pomeni nekaj, kar je narejeno iz blaga ali papirja, tako močno potegniti, da v tistem nastane luknja ali razpade na koščke.

seg.quote: He tore both letters into small pieces.
I tugged at the sleeve to get it free. It tore.

sense.def:
A tear
je luknja, ki nastane v blagu, ko ga potegnemo.

seg.quote: There was a triangular tear at the knee of his trousers.

sense.def:
To tear something open
pomeni nekaj raztrgati in s tem odpreti.

To tear something from somewhere
pomeni nekaj s silo odstraniti od nekod.

seg.quote: She tore several sheets out of the book.
Boats were torn from their moorings by the storm.

sense.def:
To tear somewhere
pomeni nekam hiteti.

seg.quote: They tore down the street after the dog.

sense.def:
To be torn between two or more things
pomeni, da se tista oseba ne more odločiti med dvema ali več stvarmi in je zato nesrečna.

To tear something apart
pomeni, da nekaj s silo razdelimo na več kosov.

Kadar nekaj
tears an organization or country apart
, povzroči usodne prepire in motnje v delovanju ustanove ali države.

seg.quote: ...a crisis which threatens to tear society apart.

sense.def:
To tear at something
pomeni z vso silo vleči koščke z nečesa.

seg.quote: The boys tore at the meat like wolves.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo
tears oneself away from a place
, zelo nerad zapusti tisti kraj.

seg.quote: Mourners often find it difficult to tear themselves away from the grave.

sense.def:
To tear down a building
pomeni podreti stavbo.

seg.quote: It is often cheaper to tear down the buildings than to modify them.

sense.def:
To tear one's clothes off
pomeni hitro in grobo odstraniti oblačila s telesa.

To tear up a piece of paper
pomeni razkosati papir na veliko majhnih delov.
